definition: A measure of the capacity to do work or cause change, typically associated with physical or mental exertion. It is commonly employed in various scientific and technical contexts, and frequently used to describe the ability to generate power or perform tasks.

examples.german: Energie ist die Fähigkeit, Arbeit zu verrichten.
examples.english: Energy is the ability to do work.

examples.german: Er hat viel Energie in dieses Projekt gesteckt.
examples.english: He put a lot of energy into this project.

examples.german: Die Sonne liefert uns Energie in Form von Licht und Wärme.
examples.english: The sun provides us with energy in the form of light and heat.

examples.german: Ich habe keine Energie mehr, um weiterzumachen.
examples.english: I don't have any more energy to continue.

examples.german: Er hat eine positive Energie, die auf andere abfärbt.
examples.english: He has a positive energy that rubs off on others.
